ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.interpolant

Class ARKInterpolant

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.interpolant.ARKInterpolant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interpolant

    public class ARKInterpolant
extends java.lang.Object
implements Interpolant
    An interpolant for a 2-additive Runge-Kutta method when it can be represented by two standard Runge-Kutta interpolants.

    Christopher A. Kennedy, Mark H. Carpenter. "Additive Runge-Kutta schemes for convection-diffusion-reaction equations.". Applied numerical mathematics, vol. 44, pg.139-181, 2003.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ARKInterpolant

        public ARKInterpolant(double[][] coefficients_one,
              double[][] coefficients_two)
        Constructor to initialize the coefficients.

        The number of rows are equal to the number of stages and number the columns equal to the order of the interpolating polynomial.

        Parameters:
        coefficients_one - The coefficients for the interpolant for the first Runge-Kutta method.
        coefficients_two - The coefficients for the interpolant for the second Runge-Kutta method.

      • ARKInterpolant

        public ARKInterpolant(org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Matrix coefficients_one,
              org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Matrix coefficients_two)
        Constructor to initialize the coefficients.

        The number of rows are equal to the number of stages and number the columns equal to the order of the interpolating polynomial.

        Parameters:
        coefficients_one - The coefficients for the interpolant for the first Runge-Kutta method.
        coefficients_two - The coefficients for the interpolant for the second Runge-Kutta method.

      • ARKInterpolant

        public ARKInterpolant(Interpolant interpolant_one,
              Interpolant interpolant_two)
        Constructor to initialize the coefficients.

        The number of rows are equal to the number of stages and number the columns equal to the order of the interpolating polynomial.

        Parameters:
        interpolant_one - The interpolant to use for the first component RK method.
        interpolant_two - The interpolant to use for the second component RK method.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate_interpolant

        public org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector evaluate_interpolant(org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector y0,
                                                                  org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector y1,
                                                                  org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 theta,
                                                                  org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 dt,
                                                                  java.lang.Object stage_values)
        Evaluates the interpolant.
        Specified by:
        evaluate_interpolant in interface Interpolant
        Parameters:
        y0 - The solution at the beginning of the step.
        y1 - The solution at the end of the step.
        theta - The fractional distance within the current step to find the dense output.
        dt - The current stepsize.
        stage_values - The stage values for this step when applicable.
        Returns:
        The dense output value at the fraction theta within the stepsize.

      • get_KC43_interpolant

        public static ARKInterpolant get_KC43_interpolant()
        Get the interpolant for the KC43 method.

        Christopher A. Kennedy, Mark H. Carpenter. "Additive Runge-Kutta schemes for convection-diffusion-reaction equations.". Applied numerical mathematics, vol. 44, pg.139-181, 2003.

        Returns:
        The interpolant for the KC43 method.
